thread.title: This Season Sees Most Anticipated Titles to Drop Since Launch of Next Generation Consoles
thread.title_full: This Season Sees Most Anticipated Titles to Drop Since Launch of Next Generation Consoles

title: This Season Sees Most Anticipated Titles to Drop Since Launch of Next Generation Consoles
text:
Dark Souls III: December 31 
PC players will reap the rewards too – Lost Horizon , Read Only Memories, Anno 2205 , No Man’s Sky (also available on the PS4), Soma (also on PS4), Fallout Anthology, Civilization: Beyond Earth - Rising Tide Expansion (PC, Mac, Linux), and Read Only Memories (PC, Mac, Linux). 
“This year has already seen some high-profile video game releases, but many of the biggest titles of 2015 are yet to come,” said Bob Puzon, senior vice president of merchandising at GameStop. “There are compelling new titles promising to take full advantage of the new hardware and some of the greatest video game franchises releasing new installments. You’ll see there is something out there for everyone and in every genre.” 
Tonight more than 2,300 GameStop stores will be staying open late with launch events celebrating the release of Destiny: The Taken King, Forza Motorsport 6 and NHL 16 available for purchase starting at 12:01 a.m. EDT on September 15. 
While in store, shoppers can save 10 percent on any new game priced at $59.99 when trading any PS4 or Xbox One game toward purchases made from the launch event before midnight (good through September 16). 
Now through September 21, GameStop is featuring a trade up offer for customers that will earn them $20 credit toward the purchase of Destiny: The Taken King Collector’s or Legendary Editions when trading in a copy of the original Destiny . 
NHL 16 is also a perfect example of how customers that trade more, save more. GameStop is offering a guaranteed $30 credit to customers who trade NHL 16 by October 15. 
For gaming fans who have been waiting to jump to the next-generation consoles, GameStop has deals that make upgrading more affordable than ever. Now through September 20, customers can trade in a PlayStation 3 (120GB and greater) or Xbox 360 (250GB and greater) and get $100 credit toward the purchase of a new PlayStation 4 or Xbox One system. 
For more information about these deals, upcoming titles and to pre-order, visit any GameStop store location or www.gamestop.com . 
About GameStop 
GameStop Corp. (NYSE: GME), a Fortune 500 and S&P 500 company headquartered in Grapevine, Texas, is a global, multichannel video game, consumer electronics and wireless services retailer. 
GameStop operates more than 6,800 stores across 14 countries. The company’s consumer product network also includes www.gamestop.com ; www.Kongregate.com , a leading browser-based game site; Game Informer ® magazine, the world’s leading print and digital video game publication and the recently acquired Geeknet, Inc., parent company of ThinkGeek, www.thinkgeek.com , the premier retailer for the global geek community featuring exclusive and unique video game and pop culture products. In addition, our Technology Brands segment includes Simply Mac and Spring Mobile stores. Simply Mac, www.simplymac.com , operates 72 stores, selling the full line of Apple products, including laptops, tablets, and smartphones and offering Apple certified warranty and repair services. Spring Mobile, http://springmobile.com , sells post-paid AT&T services and wireless products through its 590 AT&T branded stores and offers pre-paid wireless services, devices and related accessories through its 69 Cricket branded stores in select markets in the U.S. 
General information about GameStop Corp. can be obtained at the company’s corporate website. Follow @GameStop on Twitter and find GameStop on Facebook at www.facebook.com/GameStop . Contacts
